metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39320 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affectedversions of FreeRDP may attempt integer addition on too narrow types leadsto allocation of a buffer too small holding the data written. A maliciousserver can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and sendit back to the server. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 andall users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not usethe `/usb` redirection switch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
freerdp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
